alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Gila (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 17 at 2:54PM MST until July 17 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Gila County near Haigler Creek in east central Arizona... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 600 PM MST. * At 252 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Haigler Creek, Haigler Canyon Campground, Rim Campground, Crook Campground, Alderwood Campground, Sinkhole Campground and Forest Road 171 Campground. This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 277 and 284. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Marsh Creek, Haigler Creek, Canyon Creek, Hunter Creek, Chevelon Canyon, Pine Creek, Cherry Creek and Sharp Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
